channel.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
channel.description:
One of my more recent projects I've been working on, is a simple to manage, simple to edit donation page. Where you don't have to do much to get it online and your players donating right away. In spirit of Halloween, I've made it black and orange. OLD: [IMG]http://i45.tinypic.com/a2t43m.png[/img] NEW: [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/2ez63jb.png[/img] It DOES NOT feature auto donation, as I have nothing to do with server sided anything anymore. Though, I'm sure, you could edit the MySQL database to include a display name, and have the server grab. That would also mean your website allows remote MySQL connections. Currently, I'm working on a couple MySQL errors, and I need to find some sort of way to make sure it works. As I have 0.00 in my paypal, and I would need to either donate to my spare acc, or have someone donate. But in time, I'll solve that. The pie graph was made by google, I just edited it to be orange (You can change the color too) and I have no clue why there is a white line on it. google has a whole resource center of graphs. Comments? Please no hate. Edit: Upon request by The Web Guy, here is my donate.php code. I know it's shitty and horrid looking, but I'm not good with php. [code=php] Server Name | Donation Center

Server Name's Donation Center

Help Server Name stay online by donating

Donations help keep the server online as well as bring more players into the game. So what's stopping you? Donate now and you can pick one of the following item sets:

Our Goal: $
We are % There. We are $ away.

The Donor List

Folks Who Showed Their Support

tags ?>

[/code] [code=php][/code]

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Davidi2:

Yea, I agree with the above. To be honest having just plain text for the goal is even worse than the graph was, I suggest you just remove the goal part for now. Also use the header types (

etc) to have some good font sizes, ‘donor list’ shouldn’t be the same size as the main header (should be smaller). I also think the gray background is just confusing. The images are a bit spaced apart for such a large space, it looks quite empty.

The plain text was only there as a temporary holder till I found a way to make the bar graph.
I’ll look into some modifications later.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

You have some improvements, like using good quality pictures, but it is in some sense worse. You need to clean it up, make it less messy get some order there. All the different font sizes in that order are hurting my eyes.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:43, topic:463023”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=566296.msg4120631#msg4120631 date=1349675635]
See, I’m horrid at the design aspect, but code, not that much of an issue. Though I’ve just started learning php so I will be no where near good at that for a while.
Anyways, I’ve been doing improvements here and there when I get the time. The picture that’s posted isn’t even accurate.
And I’ll definitely look into changing the pie chart. I just hope google has a good bar graph, I can always throw a empty thermometer under it. Or if someone can teach me to draw one through php, that’d be nice too
[/quote]

I was like this when I first started a few years back, if you don’t mind, you should post some snippets of your code too. I’m interested in seeing what you’re capable of, just copy and paste it here, remember to wrap with code tags.[/quote]
I’d love to, but my xampp server (what is holding all my php files etc.) is being lame, and google chrome says it can’t connect to localhost. So yeah. I might have to import to a webhost real fast.
Edit: Updated OP.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]

item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:42, topic:463023”]See, I’m horrid at the design aspect, but code, not that much of an issue. Though I’ve just started learning php so I will be no where near good at that for a while.
Anyways, I’ve been doing improvements here and there when I get the time. The picture that’s posted isn’t even accurate.
And I’ll definitely look into changing the pie chart. I just hope google has a good bar graph, I can always throw a empty thermometer under it. Or if someone can teach me to draw one through php, that’d be nice too :D[/quote]

I was like this when I first started a few years back, if you don’t mind, you should post some snippets of your code too. I’m interested in seeing what you’re capable of, just copy and paste it here, remember to wrap with code tags.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:41, topic:463023”]If you don’t want him posting on your threads anymore just tell me, I’ll handle it if it’s just going to cause flame wars and you don’t like the way he gives you advice.

I agree I don’t like the elitist approach he has in his posts, but he is right. It doesn’t look good. But I also understand where you come from when you say you want to do everything from scratch, it’s not very logical but I experience the same feeling when I develop Java; I don’t like to use external libraries to do work for me (like LWJGL for games, MINA/Netty for networking, etc) just because I feel like it’s not as much of an accomplishment for me.

I would suggest you completely redesign this, it really doesn’t make sense at all the way it is laid out. And scratch the pie chart idea. If you really want to have a graph, make it a filling up thermometer or a bar/line graph. The text is also kinda weird, being left aligned when everything else is centered and the spacing seems strange.[/quote]
See, I’m horrid at the design aspect, but code, not that much of an issue. Though I’ve just started learning php so I will be no where near good at that for a while.
Anyways, I’ve been doing improvements here and there when I get the time. The picture that’s posted isn’t even accurate.
And I’ll definitely look into changing the pie chart. I just hope google has a good bar graph, I can always throw a empty thermometer under it. Or if someone can teach me to draw one through php, that’d be nice too

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

If you don’t want him posting on your threads anymore just tell me, I’ll handle it if it’s just going to cause flame wars and you don’t like the way he gives you advice.

I agree I don’t like the elitist approach he has in his posts, but he is right. It doesn’t look good. But I also understand where you come from when you say you want to do everything from scratch, it’s not very logical but I experience the same feeling when I develop Java; I don’t like to use external libraries to do work for me (like LWJGL for games, MINA/Netty for networking, etc) just because I feel like it’s not as much of an accomplishment for me.

I would suggest you completely redesign this, it really doesn’t make sense at all the way it is laid out. And scratch the pie chart idea. If you really want to have a graph, make it a filling up thermometer or a bar/line graph. The text is also kinda weird, being left aligned when everything else is centered and the spacing seems strange.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:39, topic:463023”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=566296.msg4120036#msg4120036 date=1349597014]

Yes the design needs some work guys, that’s clear. However, you shouldn’t all come down on this guy, we all started somewhere and he doesn’t seem too advanced with website development, or the design aspect at least. I remember when I was in his position years ago and I tried posting something like this on Moparscape and just got tons of horrible feedback, that’s when I first started web development. This is an old saying, and I feel odd for saying it, but we all know that practice makes perfect. You guys act like you didn’t have shit projects when you were learning web development/design. The Moparscape community is better than this, we should be encouraging him to try different methods and ways to go about doing the design aspect of the website.

I have him a constructive post to begin with and then he started being a dick.
[/quote]

Valid point I suppose.[/quote]
Only because of how he approaches his posts.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:30, topic:463023”][quote author=nordiskhost link=topic=566296.msg4119434#msg4119434 date=1349520422]
If you really can’t handle some bad feedback you shouldnt be here.
I never used bootstrap or dreamweaver.
I go for Photoshop and Notepad ++
[/quote]
There’s a slight difference between feedback and just totally saying my work sucks.

Ruby responded saying all my work was horrid (in a sense) and that it pretty much was worthless. Normally, someone would comment saying something along the lines of “nice job, but I think you could edit this this and that” or even “hey, I think you should fix that, or add this” Which makes it a little more nice to say something isn’t up to par, unlike ruby’s response.[/quote]

The design totally does suck.

Read full topic

item.title: Donation page [Halloween themed][NOT released]
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“nordiskhost, post:28, topic:463023”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=566296.msg4119253#msg4119253 date=1349482888]

All people are saying is that this is horribly designed. Bootstrap is brilliant, here’s something I whipped up in like 10 minutes. The only reason it took 10 minutes was the implementing the admin panels/mod panels from previous work.

Again, people like you are why I don’t like to be on this site. You give me no effort for writing my OWN CODE. Not using a program that assists in making it FOR ME. I don’t use Dreamweaver, because it can essentially write all your code for you, along with most web design software. I’ll stick to notepad++ that only does syntax highlighting.
Instead of BASHING on it, why not give suggestions on how to improve it, besides the images and nav bar, as I’m working on those right now. I also changed the dropdown (besides the carrot, I don’t know how to exactly) too.
[/quote]

If you really can’t handle some bad feedback you shouldnt be here.

I never used bootstrap or dreamweaver.
I go for Photoshop and Notepad ++[/quote]

I use paint to make the groundwork, then translate it into CSS. o.O

Read full topic
